file_content.text: No matter what comes, House Teral will endure.
Your insecticide mines are online. The Killiks should clear out soon.
You have no idea what this means to us. The thought of their talons on our prized heirlooms....
We'll get word to the main house. Hopefully they can send some reinforcements. I thank you for this.
Do you hear that? It sounded like scurrying. Like bugs. Please, hurry.
A combat team. We're saved!
I know you. The savior of House Teral. You must help us!
Master Jedi! Thank the founders you came--it's barbarism!
Finally! I knew the Republic wouldn't abandon their allies.
Please--we have nothing left. We need help.
Alek Teral, of House Teral. We have an enclave not far from here. Peaceful, secluded--it's a place of study.
Then the Killiks found us. Came crawling in the doors, the windows, the walls... the enclave was destroyed.
I didn't know the Killiks preyed on noble houses.
The Killiks?
They're scavengers. Disgusting bugs taking advantage of Alderaan's troubles.
You seem a bit shaken.
We're covered in their filth. I almost twisted my ankle running away.
Because you let them.
Our only defense was a few insecticide mines. But there was no warning, no time to activate them.
Brinn--our groundskeeper--tried to distract them anyway. The Killiks... well, there's not much left of him now.
Would they come after survivors like you?
Where are the Killiks now?
They have what they wanted. Probably nesting in our beds. Laying eggs in the dining hall.
What an awful way to die.
Their claws ripping his flesh apart, feeding on his innards--give me a moment.
No point in staying here.
No point in staying here.
We can't abandon House Teral. We have to salvage what we can before the Killiks or the Empire get to it.
But we're not soldiers. Those insecticide mines are our only weapon. And they're sitting dormant back at the enclave, with those bugs....
Say no more.
Promise to get some real defenses here, first.
You need more than that.
A wall. A very tall wall. Guns. And men to fire them, I promise.
It takes intelligence to overrun a sentient colony.
They're more than bugs.
Sentients don't eat people. The civilized ones, anyway.
Maybe you'll grow a spine by the time I get back.
You can't even ask?
Living out here like wilders doesn't mean we forget our manners.
I charge extra for extermination. Especially bugs.
Long as you can pay.
Name your price. If the Killiks haven't eaten my purse, you'll have it.
The insecticide mines shouldn't be hard to activate--once they're online, we'll have a chance.
But do be careful. Those bugs don't understand surrender.
That's a pity. [Refuse quest]
Have you seen what those creatures can do? You can't leave us here!
House Teral transformed into a Killik hive. That I would live to see this day....
